title: A Breakthrough Law Won’t Kill Korea’s AI Revolution
snippet: Nearly a decade ago, long before ChatGPT wowed the world with its humanlike conversational abilities, Google DeepMind’s artificial intelligence system stunned South Korea when it beat legendary Go player Lee Sedol during a televised tournament in Seoul.

title: Long Island teen missing after travelling to New York City to meet Roblox contact: Report
snippet: A Long Island teenager has been missing for over two weeks after allegedly travelling alone to New York City to meet someone he met on Roblox. Police are investigating his movements, while his family and authorities appeal for public help.

title: Apple launches updated AirTag in India with longer range and louder speaker: Price, features and more
snippet: Apple has launched an updated AirTag on Monday with improved finding range, a louder speaker and deeper Find My integration. The item tracker keeps the same design and pricing in India, while adding Apple Watch support and enhanced Precision Finding.

title: Elon Musk’s X faces EU investigation over Grok deepfakes controversy: All you need to know
snippet: Elon Musk’s X is under EU investigation over claims its Grok AI chatbot failed to curb illegal deepfake content, including sexualised imagery involving children, raising fresh questions about platform responsibility under the Digital Services Act.

title: European Union opens investigation into Musks AI chatbot Grok over sexual deepfakes
snippet: European Union opens investigation into Musk's AI chatbot Grok over sexual deepfakes

title: Apple plans M5-powered Mac updates ahead of OLED MacBook Pro redesign: Report
snippet: Apple is reportedly set for a busy start to the year, with new MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, Mac Studio and Studio Display models expected soon. Reports point to M5 chip upgrades now, followed by a major MacBook Pro redesign with OLED and new features in 2026.

title: Is TikTok still down in the United States? Check current status
snippet: TikTok users across the US reported widespread app issues on January 25, with Downdetector logging over 36,000 complaints at the peak. Reports today dropped sharply, suggesting the service disruption was gradually resolved.

title: California governor alleges TikTok is suppressing content critical of Trump
snippet: California Governor ​Gavin Newsom alleged on ⁠Monday that TikTok was suppressing content critical of ‌President ‌Donald Trump and that ‌Newsom was launching a review of the social media platform's content moderation practices ​to determine ​if they violated ‌state ‍law.

title: Australian lawyer apologises for AI-generated errors in murder case
snippet: Defense lawyer Rishi Nathwani, who holds the prestigious legal title of King's Counsel, took "full responsibility" for filing incorrect information in submissions in the case of a teenager charged with murder, according to court documents seen by The Associated Press on Friday.

title: Rift at influential Silicon Valley venture firm shows tech's divide over ICE shooting
snippet: The death of ⁠37-year-old Alex Pretti was one of five shootings this month involving federal agents conducting immigration enforcement, including the fatal shooting of Minnesota woman Renee Good. At least six immigrants have died this month in federal immigration detention, an unusually rapid pace.

title: Microsoft rolls out next generation of its AI chips, takes aim at Nvidia's software
snippet: The new "Maia 200" chip comes online this week in a data center in Iowa, with plans for a second location in Arizona, Microsoft said. It is the ‌second generation of ‌an AI chip called Maia that Microsoft introduced in 2023.

title: Banks, fintechs prep for DPDP Act; Chip startups on DLI 2.0
snippet: Happy Tuesday! Banks and fintechs are readying their operations for the phased rollout of the data protection law. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: ET Graphics: Nvidia rising as AI reorders data centre market
snippet: Traditional chip giants are losing ground as new AI firms rise to the top of the pecking order. ​​Tanya Pandey breaks down how market share has changed over time and where the industry appears to be headed.

title: Semicon firms caution govt against rigid DLI framework
snippet: Industry executives broadly welcomed the intent to deepen state support for chip design companies but flagged concerns around venture capital (VC) compatibility, the structure of funding instruments, and the need for continuity for firms graduating from DLI 1.0.
